name.value: FHIR Connectathon 17 - Provider Directory - Scenario 3a - PractitionerRole Provider NPI - JSON

description.value: PractitionerRole search capabilities tests; resource format JSON; validate telecom and physical location are present; test a FHIR server's PractitionerRole search operation support using the practitioner.identifier parameter. Default values for the search parameter are based on the Practitioner Resource Example and can be modified to allow testing against other known PractitionerRole and Practitioner resource instances.
Search PractitionerRole using the practitioner.identifier search parameter with the provided identifier.system and identifier.value data values.
Search for PractitionerRole matches using the practitioner.identifier search parameter.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is JSON.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Bundle.
Confirm that there is at least one record returned. Although not expected, there could be other PractitionerRole records returned.
Confirm that there is at least one entry in the Bundle. Although not expected, there could be other PractitionerRole records returned.
Read the first PractitionerRole found in the practitioner.identifier search and verify the contents contain a telecom and physical location.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/json+fhir'.
Confirm that the returned resource type is PractitionerRole.
Confirm that the returned PractitionerRole conforms to the base FHIR specification. Warning only to allow for Example code systems.
Confirm that returned PractitionerRole contains a telecom value. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.
Confirm that returned PractitionerRole contains a location value. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.
